title: Memoirs of Charles Lee Lewes,
author: Lewes, Charles Lee

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: arrangements for a dinner to celebrate the Duke of Buccleuch coming of age that which was to have been held at Melville Castle being postponed, owing to Lord M.'s accident. Sent copy of Second Series of Chronicles of Canongate to Ballantyne.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Wrought in the morning. Then made arrangements  for a dinner to celebrate the Duke of Buccleuch coming of age that which was to have been held at Melville Castle being postponed,  owing to Lord M.'s accident. Sent copy of Second Series of Chronicles of Canongate to Ballantyne.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Morning spent in making up proofs and copy. Set out for Melville Castle with Jane, who goes on to her mother at Edinburgh.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Wrote letters to Lord Melville, etc., and agreed to act under the Commission. Settled to be at Melville Castle, Saturday 24th. I fear this will interfere consumedly  with business.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Dined at Melville Castle, whither I went through a snow-storm. I was glad to find myself once more in a place connected with many happy days.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Never stirred abroad the whole day, but was made happy after dinner by the return of Charles and Surtees full of their Irish jaunt, and happy as young men are with the change of scene. To-morrow I must go to Melville Castle. I wonder what I can do or say about these Universities.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: September 3. Went on with my arranging of papers till twelve, when I took chaise and arrived at Melville Castle. Found Lord and Lady M. and the two young ladies.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: September 3. Went on with my arranging of papers till twelve, when I took chaise and arrived at Melville Castle.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: " What am I now when every breeze appals me ?" 1 I dozed for half-an-hour in my chair for pain and stupidity. I omitted to say yesterday that I went out to Melville Castle to inquire after my Lord Melville, who had broke his collar-bone by a fall from his horse in mounting. He is recovering well, but much bruised.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
